questions.Question: What is the hottest planet in our solar system, despite not being closest to the sun?
What is the name of the supermassive black hole at the center of our Milky Way galaxy?
What is the difference between a star and a planet?
questions.answer: Stars generate their own light through nuclear fusion, while planets reflect light from their star.
options: Stars are hotter, planets are colder.
Stars are larger, planets are smaller.
Stars generate their own light through nuclear fusion, while planets reflect light from their star.

questions.Question: What is the name of the largest known structure in the observable universe?
What gas makes up the majority of the Sun's composition?
What is the name of the first human-made object to leave the solar system?
What is the difference between a nebula and a galaxy?
questions.answer: A nebula is a cloud of gas and dust in space, while a galaxy is a massive collection of stars, gas, dust, and dark matter.
options: Nebulae are hotter, galaxies are colder.
Nebulae are smaller, galaxies are larger.
Nebulae contain black holes, galaxies don't.
A nebula is a cloud of gas and dust in space, while a galaxy is a massive collection of stars, gas, dust, and dark matter.
